intro: Celsia cretica f. pallescens, commonly known as the pale Cretan celsia, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the island of Crete. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its pale green foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its unique coloration and habitat make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
